[Verse]

[ch]G[/ch]                       [ch]B[/ch]
Watching the ships roll in,

ooh I'm just sittin' on the dock of the bay
        [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]
wasting ti---ime


[Verse]

[ch]G[/ch]                 [ch]B[/ch]
I left my home in Georgia
[ch]C[/ch]              [ch]C[/ch] [ch]B[/ch] [ch]Bb[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch]
Headed for the Frisco bay
[ch]G[/ch]                       [ch]B[/ch]
'Cause I've had nothing to live for

and look like nothing's gonna come my way


[Chorus]

    [ch]G[/ch]                          [ch]E[/ch]

             [ch]G[/ch]          [ch]E[/ch]
watching the tide roll away

        [ch]G[/ch]    [ch]E[/ch]
wasting ti---ime


[Bridge]

[ch]G[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]C2[/ch]
  Look like nothing's gonna change
[ch]G[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]         [ch]C2[/ch]
       Everything still remains the same
[ch]G[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]             [ch]C2[/ch]         [ch]G[/ch]
     I can't do what ten people tell me to do
[ch]F[/ch]                    [ch]D[/ch]
   So I guess I'll remain the same


[Verse]

[ch]G[/ch]                        [ch]B[/ch]
Sittin' here resting my bones
[ch]C[/ch]                           [ch]C[/ch] [ch]B[/ch] [ch]Bb[/ch]  [ch]A[/ch]
and this loneliness won't leave me alone
[ch]G[/ch]                       [ch]B[/ch]
These 2000 miles I roamed
        [ch]C[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch] [ch]B[/ch] [ch]Bb[/ch] [ch]A[/ch]

[Chorus]

watching the tide roll away

[ch]G[/ch]             [ch]E[/ch]

name: If We Have Each Other
tuning: E A D G B E

content.text:
[Verse 1]
       [ch]Am[/ch]
She was 19 with a baby on the way
        [ch]G[/ch]
On the East-side of the city, she was working every day
          [ch]Em[/ch]
Cleaning dishes in the evening, she could barely stay awake
         [ch]F[/ch]                                                    [ch]G[/ch]
She was clinging to the feeling that her luck was gonna change
     [ch]Am[/ch]                                               [ch]G[/ch]
And, 'cross town she would take the bus at night to a one bedroom apartment

And when she'd turn on the light
           [ch]Em[/ch]
She would sit down at the table

Tell herself that it's alright
         [ch]F[/ch]                                              [ch]G[/ch]
She was waiting on the day she hoped her baby would arrive
     [ch]Am[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]
She'd never be alone
                       [ch]Em[/ch]
Have someone to hold

And when nights were cold
[ch]F[/ch]
She'd say


[Chorus]
               [ch]Am[/ch]
The world's not perfect, but it's not that bad
           [ch]G[/ch]
If we got each other, and that's all we have
               [ch]Em[/ch]
I will be your mother, and I'll hold your hand
           [ch]F[/ch]
You should know I'll be there for you
           [ch]G[/ch]         [ch]Am[/ch]
When the world's not perfect

When the world's not kind
            [ch]G[/ch]
If we have each other then we'll both be fine
                [ch]Em[/ch]
I will be your mother, and I'll hold your hand
           [ch]F[/ch]                            [ch]G[/ch]
You should know I'll be there for you


[Verse 2]
         [ch]Am[/ch]                                        [ch]G[/ch]
They were 90 and were living out their days on the West-side of the city next to where they got engaged
         [ch]Em[/ch]
They had pictures on the walls of all the memories that they'd made
           [ch]F[/ch]                                                    [ch]G[/ch]
And though life was never easy, they were thankful that they stayed
[ch]Am[/ch]
With each other, and though some times were hard
     [ch]G[/ch]
Even when she made him angry he would never break her heart
         [ch]Em[/ch]
No, they didn't have the money to afford a fancy car
          [ch]F[/ch]                                            [ch]G[/ch]
But they never had to travel 'cause they'd never be apart
[ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]G[/ch]                            [ch]Em[/ch]
Even at the end, their love was stronger than the day that they first met
 [ch]F[/ch]
They say


[Chorus]

This is a mix between gutturalguitar's version and the one I usually play. I transposed his chords up a 5th
and slapped a capo on the 4th fret, and added my own flavor. Feel free to make it your own too.

Tuning: E A D G B e capo on 4th fret

You've got an Amaj looking chord throughout the whole song. If you understand counting rhythm,
it'll help to know that you add your finger to the 4th fret on the + of 2.
It helps to do an accent on that change to emphasize it.
If you don't understand counting rhythm then you'll be fine if you listen to the song. 
For shorthand I'm just going to write this as A to A6. The same rhythm occurs in the switch from Bm to E7.
The rhythm occurs throughout the intro, verse, and prechorus.

B|--2-2-2-2-2-2-2-2----------------------------------------------------------|

D|--2-2-2-4-4-4-4-4----------------------------------------------------------|
A|--0-0-0-0-0-0-0-0----------------------------------------------------------|
E|---------------------------------------------------------------------------|
